zone.line: Chapter IV
Among our most assiduous visitors
was a young man of rank, well informed,
and agreable in his person. After we
had spent a few weeks in London
his attentions towards me became
marked and his visits more frequent. I
was too much taken up by my own occu-
-pations and feelings to attend much to this,
and then indeed I hardly noticed more
than the bare surface of events as
they passed around me; but I now remem
remember that my father was always
restless and uneasy when ever this
person visited us, and when we
talked together n watched us with the
greatest apparent anxiety although
he himself maintained a profound
silence. At length these obnoxious
visits suddenly ceased altogether, but
from that moment I must date
the change of my father: a change
